author: Arash Hekmat
title: Paul Pogba then and now: Juan Mata wishes Manchester United team-mate a happy birthday with throwback pic
text:
Juan Mata has poked some gentle fun at his Manchester United team-mate Paul Pogba on the Frenchman's 24th birthday. 
The Spanish ace shared a picture on Twitter of a young Pogba, years before the midfielder went on to become the world's most expensive player. 
And below the pic read the cheeky caption: "Same face but different hairstyle," in reference to the France international's ever-changing barnet. 
Mata also made reference to Pogba's nickname 'La Pioche', which literally means 'the pickaxe' but also refers to a young child who helps others. Juan Mata took to social media to celebrate Paul Pogba's birthday (Photo: Alex Livesey) Read More Marouane Fellaini admits Manchester United cannot afford to miss out on Champions League places 
Mata was one of several team-mates to wish Pogba many happy returns, while his brother Florentin - who Paul faced on the football pitch when Manchester United knocked St Etienne out   recently - also took to Instagram to celebrate the ocassion. 
But the 'best effort' award certainly goes to Jesse Lingard for going to the trouble of making a touching photo montage of the pair's best moments and also including a cactus emoji. 
Pogba's former club Juventus, with whom he won four consecutive Serie A titles and reached the final of the Champions League, also got in on the act.
